etymology.description: Ideogram (指事): a line below another (contrast 上).
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a mark placed beneath a baseline, expressing the idea of “down” or “below.” In contrast with 上, which marks above the line, the pair visually encodes relative position.

examples.chinese: 把书放在桌子下(把書放在桌子下)。
examples.pinyin: Bǎ shū fàng zài zhuōzi xià.
examples.english: Put the book under the table.

examples.chinese: 我们下午三点见(我們下午三點見)。
examples.english: See you at three in the afternoon.
